formula: Not very efficient: a(n) = (Sum_{i=1..n} (pi(i) - pi(i-1))*(pi(2*n-i) - pi(2*n-i-1))) + (pi(2*n-1) - pi(2*n-2)) + floor(1/n). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jan 06 2013
example: 1 is counted as a prime, so a(1)=1 since 2=1+1, a(2)=2 since 4=2+2=3+1, ..
mathematica: a[n_] := Length @ Select[PowersRepresentations[2 n, 2, 1], (#[[1]] == 1 || PrimeQ[#[[1]]]) && (#[[2]] == 1 || PrimeQ[#[[2]]]) &]; Array[a,98] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 11 2011 *)
nn = 10^2; ps = Boole[PrimeQ[Range[2*nn]]]; ps[[1]] = 1; Table[Sum[ps[[i]] ps[[2*n - i]], {i, n}], {n, nn}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Apr 11 2011 *)
program: a001031 n = sum (map a010051 gs) + fromEnum (1 `elem` gs)
where gs = map (2 * n -) $ takeWhile (<= n) a008578_list
(PARI) a(n)=my(s); forprime(p=2,n, if(isprime(2*n-p), s++)); if(isprime(2*n-1), s+1, s) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 06 2017
